intro: Rosa sylvestris var. erronea, commonly known as the wild rose variant, is a botanical curiosity with a complex taxonomic history. It is believed to be a natural hybrid or variant of Rosa sylvestris, characterized by its distinctive floral morphology and growth habits. The plant typically features fragrant pink or white flowers and thorny stems, typical of many rose species. Its leaves are compound, with serrated edges, and it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Due to its uncertain classification, it remains a subject of ongoing botanical study and debate.
